ul.li1: 641 Isaiah 64:1 in the English Bible begins here. In the Hebrew Bible, 63:19 continues Would that you would tear the heavens and come down;
ul.li2: the mountains would quake before you,
ul.li1: 2Isaiah 64:2–12 in the English Bible is 64:1–11 in the Hebrew Bible as fire kindles brushwood,
ul.li2: the fire causes water to boil,
ul.li1: to make your name known to your adversaries,
ul.li2: that the nations might tremble from your presence.Literally “face”
ul.li1: 3When you did terrible deeds which we did not expect,Literally “await” you came down;
ul.li2: the mountains quaked because of your presence.Literally “face”
ul.li1: 4And since ancient times they have not heard,
no eye has seen a God except you;
ul.li2: he actsLiterally “makes” for the one who waits for him.
ul.li1: 5You meet with the one who rejoices,
In your ways they remember you.
ul.li2: Look! You were angry and we sinned against them in ancient times and we were saved.
ul.li1: 6And we all have become like the unclean,
ul.li2: and all our deeds of justice like a menstrual cloth,
ul.li1: And we all wither like a leaf,
ul.li2: and our iniquities take us away like the wind.
ul.li1: 7And there is no one who calls on your name,
ul.li2: who pulls himself up to keep hold of you,
ul.li1: for you have hidden your face from us,Or “him”
ul.li2: and melted us into the hand of our iniquity.
ul.li1: 8Yet now Yahweh, you are our father;
ul.li2: we are the clay and you are our potter,Literally “one who fashions”
and we all are the work of your hand.
ul.li1: 9You must not be exceedingly angry, Yahweh,
ul.li2: and you must not remember iniquity forever!

chapter.p: Look! Behold, now! We all are your people!

ul.li1: 10Your holy citiesLiterally “The cities of your holiness” have become a wilderness;
ul.li2: Zion has become a wilderness, Jerusalem a desolation.
ul.li1: 11Our holy and beautiful temple,Literally “the house of our holiness and our beauty” where our ancestorsOr “fathers” praised you has been burnedLiterally “been for burning” by fire,
ul.li2: and all our precious objects have become ruins.Hebrew “ruin”
ul.li1: 12Will you control yourself because of these, Yahweh?
ul.li3: And will you oppress us exceedingly?
